# Output generated by @ua_chatgpt_bot

Ваше питання: Write a 2d game platformer in c++ language

Відповідь: #include <iostream>
#include <string>
#include <vector>
#include <map>
#include <algorithm>
#include <queue>

using namespace std;

//Coordinate data structure
struct Coordinate
{
	int x;
	int y;
};

//2D game platformer class
class Platformer2D
{
private:
	//represents the number of rows and columns in the game level
	int rows, cols;

	//represents the game level represented as a 2D vector
	vector< vector<char> > level;
	
	//represents the player's position
	Coordinate player_position;

	//represents the goal's position
	Coordinate goal_position;

public:
	//default constructor
	Platformer2D()
	{
		rows = 0;
		cols = 0;
	}

	//parameterized constructor
	Platformer2D(int _rows, int _cols, vector< vector<char> > _level)
	{
		rows = _rows;
		cols = _cols;
		level = _level;
	}

	//function to set the player's initial position
	void setPlayerPosition(int x, int y)
	{
		player_position.x = x;
		player_position.y = y;
	}

	//function to set the goal's position
	void setGoalPosition(int x, int y)
	{
		goal_position.x = x;
		goal_position.y = y;
	}
	
	//function to check if a certain coordinate is out of bounds
	bool isOutOfBounds(int x, int y)
	{
		if (x < 0 || x > cols || y < 0 || y > rows)
			return true;

		return false;
	}

	//function to get the next valid moves, returns a list of valid moves' coordinates
	vector< Coordinate > getNextMoves(int x, int y)
	{
		//list to store valid moves
		vector< Coordinate > valid_moves;

		//coordinates of the four adjacent moves
		int x1 = x, y1 = y - 1;
		int x2 = x + 1, y2 = y;
		int x3 = x, y3 = y + 1;
		int x4 = x - 1, y4 = y;

		//check for each of the four adjacent moves
		if (!isOutOfBounds(x1, y1) && level[y1][x1] == '.')
			valid_moves.push_back({x1, y1});
		if (!isOutOfBounds(x2, y2) && level[y2][x2] == '.')
			valid_moves.push_back({x2, y2});
		if (!isOutOfBounds(x3, y3) && level[y3][x3] == '.')
			valid_moves.push_back({x3, y3});
		if (!isOutOfBounds(x4, y4) && level[y4][x4] == '.')
			valid_moves.push_back({x4, y4});

		return valid_moves;
	}

	//function to check if there is a path from player to goal
	bool isPath()
	{
		//map and queue for bfs algorithm
		map<Coordinate, bool> visited;
		queue<Coordinate> q;

		//insert the player's position into the queue
		q.push(player_position);

		//mark the player's position as visited
		visited[player_position] = true;

		//start bfs
		while (!q.empty())
		{
			//get the top item
			Coordinate current = q.front();

			//pop the top item
			q.pop();

			//check if the current position is the goal
			if (current.x == goal_position.x && current.y == goal_position.y)
				return true;

			//get the next valid moves
			vector< Coordinate > next_moves = getNextMoves(current.x, current.y);

			//iterate over each valid move
			for (Coordinate next : next_moves)
			{
				//check if the coordinate has been visited
				if (visited[next] == false)
				{
					//add coordinate to queue
					q.push(next);

					//mark coordinate as visited
					visited[next] = true;
				}
			}
		}

		//return false if no path is found
		return false;
	}
};

int main()
{
	//dummy game level
	vector< vector<char> > level =
	{
		{'#', '#', '#', '#', '#'},
		{'#', '.', '.', '.', '#'},
		{'#', '.', '#', '.', '#'},
		{'#', '.', '.', 'G', '#'},
		{'#', 'E', '#', '#', '#'}
	};

	//create the Platformer2D object
	Platformer2D game(5, 5, level);

	//set player position
	game.setPlayerPosition(3, 4);

	//set goal position
	game.setGoalPosition(3, 3);

	//check for path
	if (game.isPath())
		cout << "Path found!" << endl;
	else
		cout << "No path found!" << endl;

	return 0;
}
